topic.name: Prolegomena and Backgrounds (Foundations)
topic.description: 13-year academic progression (K-12) for Prolegomena and Backgrounds (Foundations) in Bible & Theology

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Identify the Temple as the special place where people went to pray.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Name the land where Jesus lived as Israel.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Identify the New Testament as God's Word.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Name the Apostles as the men who wrote the books.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Identify that there was a long quiet time before Jesus came.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Name 400 years as the time between the Testaments.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Roman World at the Time of Christ
objectives.objective_text: Identify Roman soldiers by their armor.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Roman World at the Time of Christ
objectives.objective_text: Name Caesar as the boss of the Roman Empire.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Jewish people were waiting for a Rescuer.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Observe that they read the Old Testament scrolls.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Recall that the Bible is true and special.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Observe that the books are collected into one big book.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Recall that people were waiting and praying.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Observe that God was still working even when He was silent.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.sub_topic_name: The Roman World at the Time of Christ
objectives.objective_text: Recall that Romans built big roads.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Roman World at the Time of Christ
objectives.objective_text: Observe a coin that Jesus might have used.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between the Temple and a Synagogue.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Explain who the Pharisees and Sadducees were.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Context of the New Testament (Second Temple Judaism)
objectives.objective_text: Locate Judea, Samaria, and Galilee on a map.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the messianic expectations of the first century.

objectives.objective_text: Perform research on the works of Josephus.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Summarize how we got the 27 books of the NT.

objectives.objective_text: Explain that 'Canon' means a measuring stick or rule.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Categorize the books by author (Paul, John, Peter, etc.).

objectives.objective_text: Explain why the Gnostic gospels were rejected.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Defend the reliability of the textual transmission of the NT.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Produce a study on the self-attesting nature of Scripture.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Summarize why it is called the 'Silent Years' (no prophets).

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Explain the story of the Maccabees and Hanukkah.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Categorize the major empires between Malachi and Matthew (Greek, Roman).

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Explain the rise of the synagogue system.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Defend the continuity of God's plan during the silent years.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Produce an essay on how this period set the stage for the 'fullness of time' (Gal 4:4).

objectives.objective_text: Summarize the Pax Romana (Roman Peace).

objectives.objective_text: Explain why tax collectors were hated.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the social hierarchy of the Roman world (citizens vs slaves).

objectives.objective_text: Perform research on the patronage system in Roman society.

objectives.objective_text: Compare the Jewish people's desire for a King with Jesus' arrival.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the political tension between the Jews and Romans.

objectives.objective_text: Connect the dispersion (Diaspora) of Jews to the spread of the Gospel.

objectives.objective_text: Compare Scripture with other good Christian books.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Analyze the criteria for canonicity (Apostolicity, Orthodoxy, Usage).

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the role of the Holy Spirit in preserving Scripture.

objectives.objective_text: Connect the early church councils to the recognition of the books.

objectives.objective_text: Compare the Persian Empire (end of OT) with the Roman Empire (start of NT).

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the impact of Alexander the Great on biblical history.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret the 'Abomination of Desolation' by Antiochus Epiphanes.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Connect the Septuagint (Greek OT) to the New Testament writers.

objectives.objective_text: Apply the concept of common language (Greek) helping missionaries.

objectives.objective_text: Analyze the benefits of Roman infrastructure for the Gospel.

objectives.objective_text: Connect Roman law and citizenship to Paul's ministry.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the influence of Hellenism (Greek culture) on Judaism.

objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the Muratorian Fragment and other early lists.

objectives.sub_subject_name: New Testament Studies: Life and Doctrine in Christ
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the Apocrypha as historical background versus inspired Scripture.

objectives.sub_topic_name: The Roman World at the Time of Christ
objectives.objective_text: Evaluate the conflict between 'Jesus is Lord' and 'Caesar is Lord'.

objectives.objective_text: Construct a profile of the major Jewish sects (Essenes, Zealots, Pharisees, Sadducees).

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the religious climate that prepared the way for Christ.

objectives.objective_text: Construct a defense of the closed canon.

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the political environment of the Gospels and Acts.

objectives.objective_text: Identify that we listen to stories to learn about Jesus.

objectives.objective_text: Recall that we should do what the Bible says.

objectives.objective_text: Ask 'What does this teach me about God?'

objectives.objective_text: Summarize the difference between what it meant then and what it means now.

objectives.objective_text: Explain that context (what comes before and after) is important.

objectives.objective_text: Explain the danger of taking verses out of context.

objectives.objective_text: Defend the perspicuity (clarity) of Scripture for essential doctrines.

objectives.objective_text: Compare a letter (Epistle) with a story (Gospel).

objectives.objective_text: Apply the principle of letting Scripture interpret Scripture.

objectives.objective_text: Interpret parables differently than historical narrative.

objectives.objective_text: Synthesize the grammatical-historical method of interpretation.
